item.title: Denoising Diffusion Models Part 1: Estimating True Distribution
item.description: Code for this blog post: Notebook Github Link Colab Basic: Predicting Original Distribution Vanilla Implementation What are Denoising Diffusion Models? Denoising Diffusion Models, commonly referred to as “Diffusion models”, are a class of generative models based on the Variational Auto Encoder (VAE) architecture. These models are called likelihood-based models because they assign a high likelihood to the observed data samples $p(X)$. In contrast to other generative models, such as GANs, which learn the sampling process of a complex distribution and are trained adversarially.

item.title: Denoising Diffusion Models Part 2: Improving Diffusion Models
item.description: Code for this blog post: Notebook Github Link Colab Predicting Error and Score Function Error / Score Prediction Classifier free Guidance and other improvements Advanced concepts Topics to cover We have done most of the heavy-lifting in Part 1 of this series on Diffusion Models. To be able to use them well in practice, we might need to make some more improvements. That’s what we will do. Time step embedding and concatenation/fusion to the input data.
